definition: plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc

sentences.english: She tore it open and fished out a note the same size as the first one.
sentences.chinese: 她將它拆開，拿出一張與第一封信一樣大小的便條紙。

sentences.english: How about those Post-it Notes that get stuck just about everywhere these days?
sentences.chinese: 至於最近，那些到處貼的立可貼便條紙呢？

sentences.english: Set a time limit and come up with as many ideas as you can, one per sticky note.
sentences.chinese: 設定時限，儘量相出各種點子，每個點子一張便條紙。

sentences.english: That's twice I forgot to take slips from the library counter.
sentences.chinese: 我已經是第二次忘記從圖書館的櫃檯上拿些便條紙了。

sentences.english: I always keep a pad of paper by the phone.
sentences.chinese: 我總是在電話旁放一疊便條紙。

sentences.english: Our daily shopping list was written on scrap paper in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 過去我們在廚房裏將日常購物清單寫在便條紙上。

sentences.english: Each student should have a pencil and pad.
sentences.chinese: 每個學生都應有一枝鉛筆和一本便條紙簿。
